element.name: The Sword In The Stone by toczygroszek, Traditional Cache (2.5/2.5)

long-description.p: "Sword in the Stone" is a famous part of King Arthur's Legend. Arthur was the first son of King Uther Pendragon. He was heir to the throne, but these were very troublous times and magician Merlin decided to hide him in a secret place. When King Uther died, a big rivalry about his throne started. Merlin using his magic set sword in the stone (in other version anvil). On this sword there was a golden inscription: "Whoso pulleth out this sword of this stone is the rightwise born king of all England". Many people tried to pull it out but without success. Finally, Arthur manage to withdraw the sword and after that he became king.

Now I have a special task for geocaching heroes:
"Whoso pulleth out this cache of this stone is the rightwise born king of Geocaching"
And the first is the King of Kings!
Good luck!

element.encoded-hints: If you are rightwise born king of Geocaching you don’t need any hints!

ul.li:
2010-06-13T10:47:52Z : Found it by Simotaniously
Second time round. Found it!! Excellent hide. Loving the cache.

2010-06-12T19:00:00Z : Found it by BlueFoxPL
Another great day for caching... found with some friends. TFTC.

2010-06-12T19:00:00Z : Found it by Wicca Cailín
Great fun searching for this one. Great cache too. Great imagination. Found with Blue Fox PL. TFTC.

2010-06-12T19:00:00Z : Found it by colmyster
One of the most enjoyable caches we've done yet. TFTC !! TNLN

2010-05-30T19:00:00Z : Didn't find it by Simotaniously
too many mugglers about

2008-10-11T19:00:00Z : Found it by Kersti.com
Before we headed to this one I wasn't so sure - the DNFs have been logged by some pretty seasoned cachers so I wasn't feeling too confident. Surprisingly tho we had the cache in hand very quickly. Perfect container, exactly what I hoped it would be!

wpt.name: GC1FV46
wpt.desc: The Sword In The Stone by toczygroszek, Traditional Cache (2.5/2.5)

groundspeak:cache.groundspeak:name: The Sword In The Stone
groundspeak:cache.groundspeak:long_description:
"Sword in the Stone" is a famous part of King Arthur's Legend. Arthur was the first son of King Uther Pendragon. He was heir to the throne, but these were very troublous times and magician Merlin decided to hide him in a secret place. When King Uther died, a big rivalry about his throne started. Merlin using his magic set sword in the stone (in other version anvil). On this sword there was a golden inscription: "Whoso pulleth out this sword of this stone is the rightwise born king of all England". Many people tried to pull it out but without success. Finally, Arthur manage to withdraw the sword and after that he became king.




Now I have a special task for geocaching heroes:

"Whoso pulleth out this cache of this stone is the rightwise born king of Geocaching"

And the first is the King of Kings!

Good luck!

One of the most enjoyable caches we've done yet. TFTC !! TNLN
